root.title: Altyn-Kol (е-29)
root.place: Two stones (е-28, е-29) were found near small lake Altyn-Kol on right bank the river Abakan in 10 km from modern settlement Bondarev. They were found out in territory of a burial ground among group of barrows in several meters from each other.
root.store: Martyanov moved to the Minusinsk museum in 1881. Inv.# 28.
root.general: The stele is made of brown sandstone. Rectangular in section. Surfaces are carefully processed. Top part is rounded off.
root.description: The text of 8 lines is located vertically on three sides. Lines are divided by relief grooves. A line goes by perimeter of the stela on face side.
root.size: Height – 195 cm, length – 50 cm, width – 15 cm
root.investigation: Found in 1878 by peasants Korchakov and Markov. Klyashtornyi made a graphic copy and detailed text comments.

pdf.f_title: Памятники тюркской рунической письменности азиатского ареала.
Выпуск второй. (Табл. VI, XXVII, XXXVI, LIII, LXI, LXIII, LXXI-LXXXII. Съ двумя маршрутами Орхонской Экспедиціи)
pdf.f_in: Атласъ древностей Монголіи. Изданный по поручению Императорской Академіи Наукъ В.В.Радловымъ. //Труды Орхонской экспедиціи. – Санктпетербургъ, Типография Императорской Академіи Наукъ, 1892.
